question: Ibrahima Kassory Fofana took Charge as the Prime Minister of which country in West Africa?
explanation: Ibrahima Kassory Fofana took Charge as the Prime Minister of Guinea. He replaced Mamady Youla. Earlier,Ibrahima Kassory Fofana was Minister in Charge of Public Investment and relations with the private Sector. After assuming the Charge,he hadn't made major Changes in the Cabinet.He handed economy portfolio to Mamadi Camara, Guinea's ex-ambassador to South Africa,while the defence, foreign affairs and justice ministers remain unchanged.
